section_title: Arthroscopic or Open Surgical Procedures for Shoulder Instability and/or Laxity (Evidence: pg no: 11, L446-L447)
names: Shoulder Instability Surgery (Evidence: pg no: 11, L446)
description: Surgical procedures for post-traumatic or atraumatic shoulder instability and/or laxity with specific instability test requirements (Evidence: pg no: 11, L450-L472)
scope: Arthroscopic or open surgical procedures for shoulder instability and/or laxity (Evidence: pg no: 11, L450-L451)

documentation: Documented history of 'post-traumatic' or 'atraumatic' instability and/or laxity that has resulted in function-limiting pain (Evidence: pg no: 11, L452-L455)
Individual demonstrates ONE OR MORE positive orthopedic tests including Anterior or Posterior Apprehension Test, Sulcus Sign, Load and Shift Test (Evidence: pg no: 11, L456-L460)

Failure of provider-directed non-surgical management for at least three (3) months in duration that includes shoulder stabilization/strengthening exercises, except when irreducible shoulder dislocation or anterior shoulder instability in competitive contact or collision athletes (Evidence: pg no: 11, L461-L466)
Advanced diagnostic imaging study (e.g., MRI, CT) demonstrates labral tear (e.g., Bankart, capsular tear) and correlates with symptoms and physical exam findings (Evidence: pg no: 11, L467-L469)

Other potential pathological conditions have been excluded including fracture, thoracic outlet syndrome, brachial plexus disorders, referred neck pain, cervical radiculopathy, and advanced glenohumeral osteoarthritis (Evidence: pg no: 11, L470-L472)

exclusions: Any other indication or condition (Evidence: pg no: 11, L476-L477)
Superior capsular reconstruction using any type of graft - considered experimental, investigational, or unproven (Evidence: pg no: 11, L481-L482)

codes.description: Capsulorrhaphy, anterior; Putti-Platt procedure or Magnuson type operation (Evidence: pg no: 13, L547)
Capsulorrhaphy, anterior; with labral repair (e.g. Bankart procedure) (Evidence: pg no: 13, L548)
Capsulorrhaphy, anterior, any type; with bone block (Evidence: pg no: 13, L549)
Capsulorrhaphy, anterior, any type; with coracoid process transfer (Evidence: pg no: 13, L550)
Capsulorrhaphy, glenohumeral joint, posterior, with or without bone block (Evidence: pg no: 13, L551)
Capsulorrhaphy, glenohumeral joint, any type multi-directional instability (Evidence: pg no: 13, L552)
Arthroscopy, shoulder, surgical; capsulorrhaphy (Evidence: pg no: 13, L557)

notes: Conservative management exceptions for irreducible shoulder dislocation or anterior shoulder instability in competitive contact or collision athletes (Evidence: pg no: 11, L463-L466)
